p: Flavonoids and phenolic compounds in herbal plants have been associated with antimalarial activity [ 46] and could be the reason for the much higher activity exhibited by A. cordifolia, which contained much higher levels of phenolic and flavonoid content relative to M. indica ( Table 4). The phenolic content of A. cordifolia has been suggested to be mainly composed of ellagic acid, a water-soluble polyphenol that has been suggested to be responsible for the antiplasmodial activity of A. cordifolia [ 47].
